Overview  Package  Class   Use  Tree  Deprecated  Index  Help 
 PREV   NEXT FRAMES    NO FRAMES    

Uses of Package
peregrine

Packages that use peregrine
peregrine Main peregrine package including core interfaces for writing jobs. 
peregrine.app.benchmark Benchmark framework which writes keys using an ExtractWriter and then runs a map and reduce job across them. 
peregrine.app.flow A graph 'flow' algorithm which checks for root node graph connectivity. 
peregrine.app.pagerank Pagerank implementation which uses advanced features like merge, broadcast variables, to speed up computation. 
peregrine.app.pagerank.compact Take a minor graph compaction, and a major graph compaction, and merge them. 
peregrine.app.pagerank.extract   
peregrine.client Client API implementation which supports GET, SCAN, PUT, etc. 
peregrine.client.console Console interface for working with the bigtable client. 
peregrine.combine Combiner support or dealing with streaming key/value pairs and combining them before sending them out over the wire. 
peregrine.config Contains the configuration backend for peregrine and all associated classes; The API needs to pass Config objects within the system and this is the main way of obtaining them. 
peregrine.config.partitioner Code to route/map keys to their partitions. 
peregrine.controller Main interface for the controller which allows one to kick off and execute jobs in the cluster. 
peregrine.controller.client Client interfaces for calling RPC endpoints on the controller. 
peregrine.controller.rpcd.delegate RPC delegates for the controller. 
peregrine.io Main IO package including high level IO references. 
peregrine.io.chunk Code for dealing which chunks (which are fragments of partition files). 
peregrine.io.driver Provides a way to integrate external IO into peregrine (Cassandra, MySQL, hbase, etc). 
peregrine.io.driver.blackhole IO driver for writing to nothing (AKA a blackhole). 
peregrine.io.driver.broadcast Broadcast IO driver for sending data to all nodes. 
peregrine.io.driver.example Example driver which can be used as a template for creating new drivers. 
peregrine.io.driver.file IO driver for writing to the PFS filesystem. 
peregrine.io.driver.shuffle Shuffle IO driver. 
peregrine.io.memtable Memtable implementation including arena support and record lookup. 
peregrine.io.partition Code for writing partition files which are automatically written to the correct hosts and split into chunks. 
peregrine.io.sstable Disk-based SSTable implementation supporting indexes and checksums. 
peregrine.map   
peregrine.merge   
peregrine.reduce Handles sorting, merging, and reducing shuffle data. 
peregrine.reduce.merger Merge engine for the reducer. 
peregrine.reduce.sorter Sort engine for the reducer. 
peregrine.shuffle Generic shuffle data parsing functionality. 
peregrine.shuffle.sender Sends shuffle output from mappers. 
peregrine.sort Sort infrastructure for globally sorting data. 
peregrine.task Task framework for map/reduce/merge. 
peregrine.util Util classes for use (crypto, queues, etc). 
peregrine.util.netty Extensions and additional code for using Netty and async IO. 
peregrine.worker.clientd.requests Code related to request handling. 
 

Classes in peregrine used by peregrine
Batch
          A 'batch' of jobs sent to the controller at once.
Job
          Represents a job (map, merge, or, reduce) which much be run by Peregrine.
KeyValuePair
          Create a key/value pair used to represent and entry in computation.
StructReader
          API for dealing with complex data structures as high level types.
StructWriter
           Write data to a struct and convert it to a StructReader when done.
 

Classes in peregrine used by peregrine.app.benchmark
Batch
          A 'batch' of jobs sent to the controller at once.
Job
          Represents a job (map, merge, or, reduce) which much be run by Peregrine.
Mapper
          A map task implementation which maps keys to values and then emits them.
Reducer
          Take a key and list of values, and reduce them and emit result.
StructReader
          API for dealing with complex data structures as high level types.
